required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Study of Atomoxetine in Children With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (AD/HD)
clinical_study.official_title: Long-Term Extension, Open-Label Study of Atomoxetine Hydrochloride in Child Outpatients With Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The study is long-term extension study to evaluate long-term safety and efficacy of Atomoxetine in Japanese pediatric patients with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (AD/HD).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events for Long Term Safety and Tolerability
primary_outcome.description: Details on the actual adverse events are presented in the Reported Adverse Events Section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline at Various Timepoints in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Translated in Japanese Parent Version: Investigator Administered and Scored (ADHDRS-IV-J:I) Total Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 Months, 12 Months, 2 Years, 3 Years, 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total scores range from 0 to 54.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline at Various Timepoints in the Clinical Global Impressions-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Severity (CGI-ADHD-S)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 Months, 12 Months, 2 Years, 3 Years, 4 Years
secondary_outcome.description: Measures severity of the participant's overall severity of ADHD symptoms (1=normal, not at all ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients).

Participants were categorized as either extensive metabolizers (EM) or poor metabolizers (PM). CYP2D6 is the primary atomoxetine metabolizing enzyme. The CYP2D6 genotype were analysed by testing the *2, *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, *8, and *10 alleles. Metabolizer status was determined by focusing on the normal(wild type, *2), decreased(*10), and defective allele(*3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8). PM were assigned to the patients had two defective alleles in any combination of *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8 alleles. EM was all except for PM.

arm_group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

intervention.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who met all of the disease diagnostic and study criteria at Visit 2 of previous placebo-controlled study, completed the study
- Patients wish to enter into this study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients whose families anticipate a move outside the geographic range of the investigative site, or who plan extended travel inconsistent with the recommended visit interval

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This ongoing study is being conducted as a follow-up investigation of ADHD pediatric patients who completed Study LYBC (NCT00191295).

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

measure.title: ADHD Rating Scale-IV-Translated in Japanese Parent Version: Investigator Administered/Scored
measure.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total scores range from 0 to 54.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impressions-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Severity (CGI-ADHD-S)
measure.description: Measures total improvement (or worsening) of a participant's ADHD symptoms from the beginning of treatment. (1=very much improved, 7=very much worsened).

measure.title: Mean Age at Onset of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School Aged Children-PL
measure.description: The Kiddie Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for School Aged Children-Present and Lifetime Version (K-SADS-PL) is a semi-structured interview schedule for assessing psychiatric disorders in children and adolescents. It is used to assess the status of 32 DSM-IV child and adolescent psychiatric diagnosis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events for Long Term Safety and Tolerability
outcome.description: Details on the actual adverse events are presented in the Reported Adverse Events Section.
outcome.population: All patients who took at least one dose of study medication were included in the analyses of safety data.

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events for Long Term Safety and Tolerability
measure.description: Details on the actual adverse events are presented in the Reported Adverse Events Section.
measure.population: All patients who took at least one dose of study medication were included in the analyses of safety data.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline at Various Timepoints in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Translated in Japanese Parent Version: Investigator Administered and Scored (ADHDRS-IV-J:I) Total Score
outcome.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total scores range from 0 to 54.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 6 Months, 12 Months, 2 Years, 3 Years, 4 Years
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: Participants who met Study LYBC criteria, took 1 dose of drug, had a baseline/post-baseline measurement. Changes from baseline used LOCF approach. Baseline was the last non-missing measurement before taking atomoxetine (either LYDA Week 0 or LYBC Week 2). Endpoint was the last non-missing measurement in each assessment period.

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

measure.title: Change From Baseline at Various Timepoints in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-IV-Translated in Japanese Parent Version: Investigator Administered and Scored (ADHDRS-IV-J:I) Total Score
measure.description: Measures the 18 symptoms contained in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders Fourth Edition, Text Revision (DSM-IV-TR) diagnosis of Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder. Individual item scores range from 0 (none/never or rarely) to 3 (severe/very often). Total scores range from 0 to 54.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set: Participants who met Study LYBC criteria, took 1 dose of drug, had a baseline/post-baseline measurement. Changes from baseline used LOCF approach. Baseline was the last non-missing measurement before taking atomoxetine (either LYDA Week 0 or LYBC Week 2). Endpoint was the last non-missing measurement in each assessment period.

measure.title: Change From Baseline at Various Timepoints in the Clinical Global Impressions-Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder-Severity (CGI-ADHD-S)
measure.description: Measures severity of the participant's overall severity of ADHD symptoms (1=normal, not at all ill; 7=among the most extremely ill patients).
measure.population: Full Analysis Set: Participants who met Study LYBC criteria, took 1 dose of drug, had a baseline/post-baseline measurement. Changes from baseline used LOCF approach. Baseline was the last non-missing measurement before taking atomoxetine (either LYDA Week 0 or LYBC Week 2). Endpoint was the last non-missing measurement in each assessment period.

outcome.title: Cytochrome P450 2D6 (CYP2D6) Phenotype Status
outcome.description: Participants were categorized as either extensive metabolizers (EM) or poor metabolizers (PM). CYP2D6 is the primary atomoxetine metabolizing enzyme. The CYP2D6 genotype were analysed by testing the *2, *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, *8, and *10 alleles. Metabolizer status was determined by focusing on the normal(wild type, *2), decreased(*10), and defective allele(*3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8). PM were assigned to the patients had two defective alleles in any combination of *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8 alleles. EM was all except for PM.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set: Participants who met Study LYBC criteria, took 1 dose of drug, had a baseline/post-baseline measurement. Changes from baseline used LOCF approach. Baseline was the last non-missing measurement before taking atomoxetine (either LYDA Week 0 or LYBC Week 2). Endpoint was the last non-missing measurement in each assessment period.

measure.description: Participants were categorized as either extensive metabolizers (EM) or poor metabolizers (PM). CYP2D6 is the primary atomoxetine metabolizing enzyme. The CYP2D6 genotype were analysed by testing the *2, *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, *8, and *10 alleles. Metabolizer status was determined by focusing on the normal(wild type, *2), decreased(*10), and defective allele(*3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8). PM were assigned to the patients had two defective alleles in any combination of *3, *4, *5, *6, *7, or *8 alleles. EM was all except for PM.

Baseline was the last non-missing measurement before taking atomoxetine (either LYDA Week 0 or LYBC Week 2). Endpoint was the last non-missing measurement in each assessment period.

group.title: Atomoxetine
group.description: 0.5 milligrams per kilogram (mg/kg) twice daily (BID), orally (PO) titrated to 1.2 mg/kg BID, PO over 2 weeks then 1.2 to 1.8 mg/kg BID, PO for 6 months and up to 4 years

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
